pros: It's a easy job all I did was fold cloths and to listen to my podcasts. The lady that runs the place is super sweet and there are no customers. I liked getting paid every week and that they worked with me around my school schedule.
cons: My manager Ryan was a pervert and always made creepy comments so I never went back. $15 a hour is very low and it's far from campus and cold.

pros: - Everyone is really caring and understanding of your circumstances - You're able to choose which days you work - Easy to juggle this job if you're a student
cons: None applicable, I really love working here!

pros: Great way to get more experience in the field. Very hands on internship and you get to decide on your own projects and what you're interested in working on. They are very mindful of students' lives and are very understanding.
cons: Not always super communicative or organized.

pros: flexible work schedule and employee discount
cons: working during peak football season and back to school

job_title: Sales Associate in San Antonio, TX
pros: All staff were very friendly and made the work environment fun! Little celebrations like game days, holidays, and back to school made it enjoyable to be able to work.
cons: Hard to get weekends off. Especially on game day and holidays.

review_title: An org that tries hard to listen
pros: Fun customers, opportunity to increase your skills/professionally develop, and great coworkers, financial transparency
cons: Lean team means workload can feel overwhelming at times, some teams have harder time being heard than others

pros: -Environment -Nice Employees -People of similar age
cons: Until you are a lead, you will never know what you are doing that day.

pros: I enjoyed the time with my co-workers, and helping customers who work or study at UT. It was not an overly stressful environment, and management was reasonable and friendly.
cons: There did not seem like many opportunities for growth, although I personally was not seeking a long term position there. Not many complaints.

review_title: Great job for full-time college students
job_title: Retail Sales Associate in Austin, TX
pros: The UT Co-Op is very understanding with scheduling around your class schedule as a college student- since most of the associates who work there are UT Austin students. It is also right next to campus, which makes it a great location for students as well.
cons: This place can get SUPER busy on game days, holidays, and the beginning of semester or around graduation, which can make for some stressful seasons.

pros: The co-workers/managers were really nice!
cons: Lack of lunch breaks provided.

job_title: Retail Sales Associate in Austin, TX
pros: The staff at the Co-op was very kind and easy to work with
cons: Scheduling sometimes was a bit tricky as there are a lot of part time employees

pros: 401k Match, Health Benefits, Flexible Schedule, Caring People
cons: Low Comparative Salary, Older Tech, Limited Upside

review_title: Love working here, but don't get paid my worth.
job_title: Lead Graphic Designer in Austin, TX
pros: Great culture and people. They seem to really care about you as an employee and person
cons: It's a nonprofit, so the pay is super weak. They only just recently started offering bi-annual bonuses.

pros: The management is very understanding and kind to its student workers. The other employees and customers are mostly students so the atmosphere is very relaxed.
cons: The shifts were 5 hours each. By the end of the week it was very tiring.

job_title: Lead Graphic Designer in Austin, TX
pros: Love the environment, culture and support
cons: Hate the pay. Not at all competitive

review_title: Routine job that I never had many problems with.
pros: Really flexible, I could get time off whenever I needed it.
cons: Very quiet, same thing every day, and it is manual labor so I always left tired

job_title: Customer Service Representative (CSR) in Austin, TX
pros: Great work for a student environment and competitive pay.
cons: Can be hectic with loads of people coming in especially at the beginning of semesters.

job_title: Customer Service Representative in Austin, TX
pros: Great management, friendly and very flexible/understanding in terms of your schedule/conflicts
cons: Can be overwhelming at first with lots of phone calls at once but it gets easier as you get more experience

pros: Flexible hours, often hiring new employees.
cons: It felt like I was working with a bunch of high schoolers. There were a lot of college students but most full-timers were in their late twenties, 30s, 40s, 50s. There was a lot of drama that management often played into.

pros: Allowed me to take care of what I needed
cons: Sometimes very busy and u have to continuously work

job_title: Lead Graphic Designer in Austin, TX
pros: Small, experience, great learning environment
cons: Lack of mentors and compensation

pros: Great people to work with, get to interact with university students, employee discount, decent pay, learn about textbooks and retail
cons: It can be really busy so you're always on your feet, after textbook rush and game days it can be hard to find hours.

pros: Fun and a lot to learn
cons: So must changing in layout of the shops

job_title: Retail Sales Associate in Austin, TX
pros: Decent pay, not too demanding, meet some great people
cons: Layoffs come seasonally and have to really show you want to stay to not get laid off

review_title: Stay away! Not a good place anymore!
pros:
Before the new CEO of 2016, the benefit was top notch but before I was let go they started to trim it due to financial issues. I heard they trim it more to make it comparable to most places.

You get free parking if you are full-time and could be used anytime even for football games.

Decent retirement plan

PTO comparable to private sectors

Yearly raises, but really used to pay for high insurance cost.

If you are a student this is a great place to work and a place for temp jobs

Friendly staff but too much rumors / politics going around
cons:
CEO and VPs doesn't seem to know what they are doing and if you read their bios you wonder how they made it?  

Salary distribution is very unfair.

The board members doesn't seem to care or clueless

Their financial outlook is bad due to football team and bad financial management.

Not a place for a long term career, work for UT instead, which is across the street.

review_title: Great place to work as a student
pros: The pay was better than any on campus job, and it's really close to lots of student housing so I could walk to work. The managers were always so nice and willing to be flexible with my school schedule. My coworkers were all also students and great people. There's a generous employee discount, too. Game days were hectic, but there were always fun in-store events going on and they always made sure we had lunch catered on busy days like that. This was a great job to have in college!
cons: The hiring and hour distribution could be weird at times. There would be a surge in hiring for back to school and football season with tons of employees and hours, but if you worked in off seasons the hours dwindled down, but I know they were working on this at the time I left.

review_title: Good place to work for students
job_title: Web Fulfillment Associate in Austin, TX
pros: As a student, you can't get a better location and the pay is better than most on-campus jobs. The staff are very helpful and friendly. Managers are understanding of the flexibility required for students.
cons: The Co-op has been struggling lately but I understand they are working hard to turn that around. The only complaints I had while working there is that parking is discounted, not free, for part-time employees and my manager could sometimes be slow to post work schedules.

review_title: A low-stress, enjoyable work environment with dismal pay
job_title: Textbook Stocker/Sales Associate in Austin, TX
pros:
- Competent, patient management who are good at training and commend good work
- Low-stress, positive work environment
- Exceptional benefits for full-time employees
- Strong employee camaraderie
- Strong employee loyalty, many have worked there for 10+ years 
- Lots of opportunity for overtime during rush season
cons:
- Very low wages for employees while the executives have rigged their bonuses so high that it has become a local media scandal (google: "George Mitchell made more than UT President Bill Powers")
- Stronger communication skills needed with lower-level management
- POS system and inventory database suffer from frequent problems and downtime

pros: Often fast paced work, interacting with lots of new faces, good management, they feed you if you're there on game days
cons: If you're a student, they don't really work around your hours. They're taking a big hit financially so work as much as you can or you'll get "let go" quick - no matter the quality of work you're giving

pros:
Retail environment selling clothes and souvenirs with some a longhorn or the U.T. logo. 
Good friendly people-some stay a very long time. Benefits were good at the time and 100% covered. They might have changed since then. Great location. Ability to move up if you want and are a go-getter. Keep in mind, it's still retail.
cons:
Seems like people get stuck there. 
Low pay--which is huge, but might be fine for teenagers, early 20s. 
"Game Days" can be long and tiring; work goes for 12 hrs.
If you are professional it's not always matched by coworkers.

review_title: Sales Associate at the Art Store
pros: Fun and interesting job duties. Good coworkers/manager/environment where your input matters! Paid time off for part-time permanent was awesome. Also received a handful of raises over my time there.
cons: Scheduling is strict, small staff so you have to be reliable. Hard to navigate when you have complaints.

pros:
Co-workers are nice and friendly
Environment is super upbeat

This job just depends whether or not you like working in retail, which I found out that I don't.
cons:
Management was inconsistent and unorganized. (There's like 5 managers, and I feel like only 2 of them really qualify to be one; the rest of them were rude and acted very entitled)
Sometimes you wouldn't know your schedule until the day before.
I was only working there for the summer (and part of the fall), but they never communicated to me about when my last day would be.

job_title: Financial Analyst Intern in Austin, TX
pros:
Got to see an inside scoop on all business processes.
You have the freedom to work on projects you are interested in.
cons: It was the very beginning of their internship series, so everything was brand new and we all learned as we went. It turned out to be a great experience though.

pros:
Fast-paced work experience
Enjoyable management
Great service 
I learned a lot about UT Austin and the retail industry
cons: Don't work during the summer. Be prepared to work during football games, and other popular times as

pros: good flexibility in scheduling, nice breakroom, and you get to do something a little different every day
cons: Busy seasons like football and textbook season can get pretty busy so good time management is needed since many people get many hours at this time

pros:
Fun work environment 
Mangement is nice and so is all the staff
Pay is higher than minimum wage
Flexible schedule
Close to campus 
Lots of customers come through, so you talk about UT a lot
cons:
Have to pay for your own parking
Sometimes it can be hard to get hours

pros: Laid back environment, management was very nice to me. They also have a great textbook program for college students
cons: The way this company is being run is poor. I worked in the Dallas location and things were messy. Stocking issues, transfer issues, damaged goods.

pros: The staff is mostly college students, so it's a great learning and working environment for college students. Managers and upper level staff were all very welcoming and friendly. Very understanding of your situation and always ready to help.
cons: Can't really think of any...

pros: Interesting products and friendly customers
cons:
Upper management is atrocious. Always going on about cutting hours to bring down business costs to the point of disfunction in the stores. Orders placed not being filled and leaving the store staff to fend for themselves.
Extremely profiy hungry to a fault.

pros:
Easily recognized brand.
Overall friendly customers.
cons: Extremely out of touch corporate employees. Turning the store inside out visual during every visit & extremely negative with no solutions to store problems. Plano has an oversaturated market of longhorn apparel rendering the store redundant & useless without proper marketing the company never invested in!

review_title: Great Job that can accomodate your scheduling needs.
pros: Fun work environment, Discounts on merchandise, Flexible Hours.
cons: Hours are plentiful in the Fall, but that dies down in the Spring.

review_title: It Is Okay But Not Great
pros:
Paid Time Off
Schedule Flexibility
Easy Work
cons:
Treat part time employees like they're very indispensable.
Will schedule 40 hrs/week, but will not classify as full-time
No parking

pros:
- Fun work environment
- Get to become close with employees, in a good positive environment
cons: - Fast-paced, detailed oriented work; no mistakes allowed

pros: Friendly environment. Creativity encouraged. Great benefits for employee and employees family.
cons: Communication needs improvement. Working all holidays. No pay raises.

pros: Great communication with uppers, and some great creative job freedom for a newer designer
cons: Working the floor on game days

pros: enjoyed my team and got a good employee discount
cons: didn't like my boss, way too intense for a very relaxed job

job_title: Order Fulfillment Associate in Austin, TX
pros: Textbook and merchandise discounts. Close to UT campus and features transparent management.
cons: Inconsistent and sometime inaccurate scheduling of hours.

pros:
Extremely flexible and willing to work with your needs as a student
Competitive pay
cons: Demanding if you have chronic injuries/pain

pros: flexible, company truly cares about its staff
cons: they are still working to keep pay competitive

pros: Worked well with student schedule and is on campus
cons: No cons to report yet

pros: Great pay for work, fun environment
cons: Communication lacking between departments leads to confusion

pros:
Customers are polite. 
Longhorn everything.
cons: Always tough to get alot of hours .

pros: Small store, excellent management, flexible hours
cons: Short staffed most of the time

pros: An excellent training ground for future managers.
cons: Back to School is brutal.

pros: Flexible scheduling, but that's only because most of their work force is made up of students.
cons: Everything: wage freeze, bad management, no mobility
